edu.osu.cse.mmxi.machine.memory
Class PagedMemory

java.lang.Object
  edu.osu.cse.mmxi.machine.memory.PagedMemory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Memory
Direct Known Subclasses:
FillMemory, RandomizedMemory
public abstract class PagedMemory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Memory

A representation of random access memory within a hardware computer system. Memory is divided into pages and then further into words. Words are 16-bit Java shorts. PagedMemory is stored internally as a short[][] for efficient random access to pages and words.

A memory address is given by a 16-bit quantity where the upper 7 bits denote the page number and the lower 9 bits denote the offset within that page.

Field Summary

          The default number of pages.
protected  short[][] memory
          The words of memory, stored as a double array with pages at the top level and page offsets at the second level.

Field Detail

memory

protected short[][] memory
The words of memory, stored as a double array with pages at the top level and page offsets at the second level.

DEFAULT_NUM_PAGES

public static final int DEFAULT_NUM_PAGES
The default number of pages. The value of this variable, 0x80, cannot easily be changed because the number of bits of the page encoding (7) is hard-coded into the instruction format.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

PagedMemory

public PagedMemory()
Creates a PagedMemory object with 128 pages. The memory itself is not initialized at this step, being instead initialized when the page is first used.

PagedMemory

public PagedMemory(int numPages)
Creates a PagedMemory object with a custom number of pages. The memory itself is not initialized at this step, being instead initialized when the page is first used.

Parameters:
numPages - the number of pages in memory
Method Detail

getMemory

public short getMemory(short absoluteAddress)
Retrieves the 16-bit word stored at the absolute memory address. A memory address is given by a 16-bit quantity where the upper 7 bits denote the page number and the lower 9 bits denote the offset within that page.

Specified by:
getMemory in interface Memory
Parameters:
absoluteAddress - 16-bit representation of the absolute memory address.
Returns:
the contents of the address.

                       short pageOffset)

Specified by:
getMemory in interface Memory
Parameters:
page - the jth page in all of memory
pageOffset - the ith word of the jth page.
Returns:
the contents of the ith word of the jth page.

setMemory

public void setMemory(short absoluteAddress,
                      short value)
Sets the contents of the 16-bit word stored at the absolute memory address of the current page to a 16-bit value. A memory address is given by a 16-bit quantity where the upper 7 bits denote the page number and the lower 9 bits denote the offset within that page.

Specified by:
setMemory in interface Memory
Parameters:
absoluteAddress - 16-bit representation of the absolute memory address.
value - a 16-bit value to be stored in memory.

Retrieves a page of memory, accessed through a function to allow for lazy initialization.
